SEARCH
Package objects

Class ObjectManager

java.lang.Object
objects.ObjectManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ObjectManager extends Object implements Runnable
The ObjectManager class manages all the game objects such as potions, containers, spikes, cannons, and projectiles. It controls their creation, updates, and rendering.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    ObjectManager(Playing playing)
    Constructs an ObjectManager with the specified Playing instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjectManager

      public ObjectManager(Playing playing)
      Constructs an ObjectManager with the specified Playing instance.
      Parameters:
      playing - The Playing instance to associate with the ObjectManager.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the ObjectManager's update loop in a new thread.

    • run

      public void run()
      The run method for the ObjectManager thread. It continuously updates the game objects based on the current level data and player position. Uses a sleep period to control the update rate.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the ObjectManager's update loop.

    • checkSpikesTouched

      public void checkSpikesTouched(Player p)
      Checks if the player touches any spikes and kills the player if so.
      Parameters:
      p - The player entity.

    • checkObjectTouched

      public void checkObjectTouched(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox)

    • applyEffectToPlayer

      public void applyEffectToPlayer(Potion p)
      Applies the effect of a potion to the player.
      Parameters:
      p - The potion object whose effect needs to be applied to the player.

    • checkObjectHit

      public void checkObjectHit(Rectangle2D.Float attackbox)
      Checks if the player touches any active potions and applies their effects to the player.
      Parameters:
      attackbox - The attackbox representing the area where the player touches an object.

    • loadObjects

      public void loadObjects(Level newLevel)
      Loads objects such as potions, containers, spikes, cannons, and clears the list of projectiles.
      Parameters:
      newLevel - The new level from which objects are loaded.

    • update

      public void update(int[][] lvlData, Player player)
      Updates the state of objects in the game, including potions, containers, cannons, and projectiles.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - The level data representing the game map.
      player - The player object in the game.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g, int xLvlOffset)
      Draws all objects including potions, containers, traps, cannons, and projectiles.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context.
      xLvlOffset - The horizontal level offset.

    • resetAllObjects

      public void resetAllObjects()
      Resets all objects to their initial state.
